snippet: After House Republicans slashed the Commodity Futures Trading Commission's budget by 14 percent in an appropriations bill, Brooksley Born, the agency's chairwoman under President Clinton, came to the commission's defense.
abstract: After House Republicans slashed the Commodity Futures Trading Commission's budget by 14 percent in an appropriations bill, Brooksley Born, the agency's chairwoman under President Clinton, came to the commission's defense.

headline.main: Under Budget Pressure, Regulator Gets Support From Former Chief
